info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued August 14 at 1:39PM PDT until August 16 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...HOT...DRY...WINDY...AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS TODAY FOLLOWED BY ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED THIS WEEK... .A very hot and dry air mass will produce low afternoon humidities, and when combined with afternoon and evening winds, critical fire weather conditions are expected for valleys west of the Cascades. Dry and unstable conditions could lead to rapid fire growth at the Flat Fire or any other active fires in the area. Additionally, monsoonal/tropical moisture will bring isolated to scattered thunderstorms through week. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM TO 11 PM PDT TUESDAY FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING ON DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 623 AND 624... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING ABUNDANT LIGHTNING ON DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 623 AND 624... The National Weather Service in Medford has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 2 PM to 11 PM PDT Tuesday. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued and is in effect from Wednesday afternoon through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop have a high probability of spreading rapidly. Abundant lightning can also ignite new fires and strain fire fighting resources. * AFFECTED AREA...For the warning...the northern portions of Fire weather zones 623 and 624. For the watch...portions of Fire weather zones 623 and 624. * THUNDERSTORMS...Isolated to scattered thunderstorms are expected across the northern portions of these zones on Tuesday. Scattered thunderstorms will be possible over a broader area on Wednesday. Storms will be a hybrid of wet/dry on Tuesday and trend wetter on Wednesday, but lightning strikes outside of the wet cores are still likely. * OUTFLOW WINDS...Gusts 30 to 40 mph. * DETAILED URL...View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Avoid tossing burning cigarettes on the ground, parking hot vehicles on dry vegetation, and using equipment that can cause sparks. Follow all fire restrictions. Find links to restrictions at weather.gov/medford/wildfire. One less spark, one less wildfire. Gather your fire evacuation kit now and familiarize yourself with your evacuation plan. Collect essentials you don`t want to lose and prioritize your checklist. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information. A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. These conditions promote rapid spread of fire which may become life threatening. Evacuate if ordered to, or if a fire threatens. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are possible during the valid watch time. These conditions could promote the rapid spread of wildfires which could become life- threatening. Check weather.gov/medford for forecast updates and a possible upgrade of the this watch to a Red Flag Warning.
